content: AMA The Fifth Person Investments Asked by Ang Yee GaryAsked on 17 Feb 2019How do you measure investment returns? Any recommended accounting software that can account for currency, options selling etc?3 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Rich TylerLevel 2. RookieUpdated on 11 Apr 2019Hi Ang,If all you want to see are you investment returns it is not too difficult to setup an excel spreadsheet to do it. Otherewise there are some good applications out there that can do what you want and so much more. There is Stock Market Eye that Victor mentioned and others like https://www.stockportfolioorganizer.com/ that handle various currency conversion, dividends etc.0 comments1

Victor Chng, Co-Founder at Fifth Person Pte LtdLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 19 Feb 2019Hi Gary,I measure investment return manually using excel. There are softwares that provide such services, you may want to take a look at Stock market eye. (https://www.stockmarketeye.com/)0 comments1

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019The broker platform you use may have built in P&L functions. You can use that to be divided by the initial cost of your investment to determine your returns percentage2 comments1

Ang Yee Gary17 Feb 2019Does not help as this is overall returns. Not yearly returns and does not account for increase or decrease in portfolio amount.Ang Yee Gary17 Feb 2019https://www.fundcount.com/portfolio-accounting?gclid=CjwKCAiAqaTjBRAdEiwAOdx9xnoeObuOQTwHLa9gqct0cggydZca-cIQl9SD4-KSkv6C8iA0IjYQfBoC5DoQAvD_BwE
